website_summaries.verdict: GPS with a 2.6-inch display that is easy to read and use.
pros: This feature-packed computer has a great backlit screen and a powerful battery for its size, lasting up to 30 hours
Offers navigation that gives you turn-by-turn directions
If you need more than a basic odometer, this is a good first computer
cons: Some customers reported issues connecting to the sensor

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece of Technology
customer_reviews.text: Luv it!!! functions perfectly, Great alternate to a Garmin. Battery last long it too. upload to strava once setup is instant. D/load Bryton app for your phone first, then turn on auto sync to Strava make sure the green indicator stays on. then enable Wi Fi and connect to your router. follow those steps before your first ride or you'll never be able to upload those ride data to Strava. only post wi fi setup and Bryton app setup data will upload to Strava
customer_reviews.author: oddesy33

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. More reliable than a crap Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. More reliable than a crap Garmin. Screen not as crisp as a Wahoo but is still a very readable and functional bike computer. Bryton's app is improving all the time. Everything works well. The buttons are not hard to push like a lot of wimps are saying.
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: Not the best first impression
customer_reviews.text: The first of these I have received is defective - the screen is so dark it is unreadable. The photo is as bright as this thing gets I really like the features and the unit does function - but not being able to read the screen makes this one unusable. Customer support has not responded to my inquiry - yet. I am returning and re-ordering - giving this another chance. But just one more.....
customer_reviews.author: Theodore C Powers

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely without question the best bike computer that money can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely without question the best bike computer that money can buy. I was skeptical at best but after watching a few (hundred) youtube videos I pulled the trigger am I ever so glad that I did! Nothing against the Garmins but for what I needed the price wasnt justified. This bryton 530 is everything I wanted and more. I no longer have to keep paper journals of my rides its all uploaded through bluetooth. Probrably more info than I can digest. It also connects to to your wifi and Strava. This is the best computer I have ever used glad I bought it and wouldnt think twice about pulling the trigger again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it. Easy to sinc maps but very little ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. Easy to sinc maps but very little detail on the tracks page which could be better designed. That said, the features and all sensors in the bundle for $230 is best value in bike computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ron F.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but TERRIBLE customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cheaper than others. Good battery life. Can customize screens. Cons: Cumbersome menus. Buttons hard to push. No sound warning at route checkpoints. No sound notification when going off route. Server times out in one minute or less. Map screens in km even when all other settings are in miles. No Total Time. TERRIBLE AWFUL customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Guardiano

customer_reviews.title: This device is fantastic. I had the opportunity to set it up ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is fantastic. I had the opportunity to set it up and go on a ride with my peers. Their surprise when I showed them the ride just minutes after finishing on site. Wow, it is a great price for all the goods in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All that I need and more
customer_reviews.text: This bike computer has all the measurements that I need and more. The WiFi synchronization and connectivity with Strava -- once set up -- works perfectly, with my rides shared immediately after uploading.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lunar

customer_reviews.title: Great cycling computer, best seller!
customer_reviews.text: Best cycling computer. Works great and very easy to use. Easy to setup with all the sensors, and easy to transfer info to Stava! Very happy with this product and will purchase another for my other bike. The seller has excellent customer service, they went above and beyond. Overall, very happy and will buy again from seller.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW WEHMEYER

customer_reviews.title: Have the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Very good battery life Very good accuracy Provide tons of data to your training very good screen contrast good do see even against the sun light
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good cycling computer - GPS, not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 530 for about a month now and I'm somewhat disappointed in the GPS speed and distance performance. I ride with folks using Garmins and phone apps and they are very accurate and consistent with each other recording distance. My Bryton 530 is always about 12 to 15 percent short whether under open sky or light foliage. I've tried both settings for the GPS with equal results. Other features work fine. Battery life is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This cycling computer does it all. It cost much less than a Garmin computer and has a large viewing screen. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: James J Harris

customer_reviews.title: ... using this cycling computer and until now its very good, the same to Garmin but have of price
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 days using this cycling computer and until now its very good, the same to Garmin but have of price, its work with Zwift perfectly and i recommended to everybody. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro V. Jiemenez

customer_reviews.title: Best bike computer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Buttons are stiff. Otherwise is just as good as a garmin but for much less. HRM works well, SC sensor istalls easy and works well. Although the speed part of the sensor need to be very close to the spoke magnet or will give wild speed readings. It paired to all sensors easily including my power meter.
customer_reviews.author: panic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The article is the same of the picture. I'm very satisfacted, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Julian David Alzate

customer_reviews.title: Excelent product !!
customer_reviews.text: Nice cycling computer. It gives me the all data I need, it's easier to use and configure. Its display has a perfect size and shows very useful data.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: It is a great piece of kit for recreational riders and maybe more advanced riders as well. Works Great for me!
customer_reviews.author: sicd

customer_reviews.title: This equipment is trash
customer_reviews.text: This cyclo computer is trash. I have had since January 2017. In the last 2 months I have been struggling with data download; avg speeds highly affected by trees and shade; difficulties to pair blutooth, etc. And for worse I keep e-mailing tech support and they do not respond. Do not buy, go Garmin, Cateye or Wahoo.
customer_reviews.author: Julio R.

customer_reviews.title: Good when you get it set up (it took me a long time)
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set up a Zwift station with the speed, cadence and heart rate sensors from Bryton. I'm gloriously inept and I just needed an old bike, an older magnetic trainer, an ANT dongle and a PC. The speed, cadence and heart rate sensors from Bryton all worked the first time I tried. The documentation sucks. I never got a response from Bryton customer service. I've had the unit for 3 months and I just figured out how to configure it. Go to YouTube for answers. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trulock

customer_reviews.title: Best value per dollar GPS cycling computer
customer_reviews.text: Great product, best GPS cycling computer for the money. Only complaint is the HRM was finicky from early on, ended up coming apart after about 2 years. They don't advertise it, but the F-mount works perfectly with 35mm bars by removing the rubber from the clamping-diameter! I even lost mine, "upgraded" to a different brand, and switched back when I found the Bryton again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...... no MPH
customer_reviews.text: Although the unit itself reads in MPH when you download your rides to the manufactures app as recommended your ride data is converted to metric with no option to convert it back. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Wade Robison

product_meta.title: Bryton Rider 530 GPS Cycling Computer (2.6" Display, 530T - with Smart Cadence + Speed+ HRM + F-Mount)
feature_bullets: Exquisite GPS Cycling Computer. High-sensitivity GPS receiver for fast positioning. No speed sensor installation needed. Just power on and go. IPX7 waterproof. Large and easy-to-read display. 7 customizable data screen with maximum of 12 data per page

On Device Graphical Summary. Follow track plus turn by turn navigation. Built-in compass provides heading information. Built-in barometer for training with terrain. Bryton test preloaded to test your limits and train systematically.

One second recording. Compatible with ANT+ Heart Rate monitor, speed, cadence sensors,Shimano Di2 sensor support (additional D-Fly accessory is required) and power meter for advance training. Anti-glare display for daytime and clear backlight for night rides.
Support for viewing stats on devices or uploading to Strava, Training Peaks, and Fit track.
Support Bryton app for planning trip, analyzing and sharing tracks. Strava Auto Upload to sync your activities seamlessly from Bryton app.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars104 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
